image.altText: A photo which shows Gove refinery from the air. Gove Operations is located on the Gove Peninsula in North East Arnhem land.

props.synopsis: The Commonwealth has lost a High Court battle over whether it should be liable for compensation for lost or impaired native title rights over a mining lease on the Gove Peninsula in North East Arnhem Land.

title.children: Commonwealth loses High Court battle in native title compensation claim over Gove Peninsula

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with the Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flags.

props.synopsis: A woman who received threatening photos of bullets and a suspected pipe bomb from her former partner details how she fled their home with their young children just weeks after giving birth.

title.children: Woman lives in 'constant fear' from ex-partner's violence, court hears

image.altText: 25-year-old Canberra man charged with multiple counts of dangerous driving

props.synopsis: ACT Policing releases dash-cam footage allegedly showing a 25-year-old Gungahlin man ramming other cars with his ute and breaking the back window of a moving car while in its tray and repeatedly kicking the driver.

title.children: Police release footage of violent road rage incidents in Canberra

image.altText: The exterior of a restaurant with a sign reading "Zaab".

props.synopsis: The woman, now aged 54, told the Supreme Court the stairs were poorly lit and alleged the restaurant was negligent by failing to repair the uneven surface.

title.children: Woman awarded $284K in damages after falling at Braddon restaurant

image.altText: Paul laughs while sitting in a chair, wearing a blue shirt, glasses and lanyard hanging around his neck.

props.synopsis: The head of orthopaedic surgery at Canberrra Hospital resigns, along with several other surgeons, citing concerns over operational decisions being made by Canberra Health Services.

title.children: Canberra orthopaedic surgeons resign citing operational concerns

image.altText: Looking down a reflective pool to a multi level, dome-adorned sandstone building. Walls of red poppies can be seen.

props.synopsis: Will a massive expansion of the Australian War Memorial allow it to evolve or destroy what makes it special?

title.children: Fears Australia's 'solemn' war memorial risks becoming a 'Disneyland of war'

image.altText: a boater looking out the window at sea

props.synopsis: The 34-year-old's body was found south of Eden after a three-day search by emergency services.

title.children: Body of missing Canberra rock fisher found on NSW far south coast

image.altText: 25-year-old Canberra man charged with multiple counts of dangerous driving

props.synopsis: ACT Policing releases dash-cam footage allegedly showing a 25-year-old Gungahlin man ramming other cars with his ute and breaking the back window of a moving car while in its tray and repeatedly kicking the driver.

title.children: Police release footage of violent road rage incidents in Canberra

image.altText: A prefab module for an apartment building.

props.synopsis: Prefab housing has been touted as the answer to Australia's housing supply for years, but it's an industry plagued with high costs, low scale and a desperate need for investment if it's ever going to be a solution.

title.children: Sweden builds houses in days, Australia tried to do that 50 years ago

image.altText: An aerial view of a smouldering, burnt out container ship out at sea.

props.synopsis: Police arrested the captain of the Solong container ship on Tuesday on suspicion of gross negligence and manslaughter.

title.children: Cargo ship captain arrested after UK tanker crash is Russian national

image.altText: A close-up of Donald Trump wearing a white shirt, blue suit jacket and yellow tie

props.synopsis: NASA has announced the dismissal of its chief scientist in its first round of cuts ordered by US President Donald Trump.

title.children: NASA loses chief scientist in first round of Trump-ordered cuts

image.altText: Rodrigo Duterte looks emotionlessly forward at the camera with short black hair

props.synopsis: The former Philippine president is expected to face a preliminary hearing in coming days.

title.children: Rodrigo Duterte in ICC custody on crimes against humanity charges

image.altText: A flat lay of a calculator, an electricity bill and a mobile phone displaying an ABC article about electricity prices.

props.synopsis: Power prices are set to rise yet again, with the energy market regulator lifting the benchmarks for how much retailers can charge for electricity.

title.children: Power bills to rise yet again as regulator tipped to hike price caps by up to 10pc

image.altText: People carry garbage bags picking up rubbish on a beach.

props.synopsis: Queensland's bay islands act as a natural buffer protecting the mainland from severe storm surges, and helped save Brisbane from the full force of Cyclone Alfred.

title.children: A cluster of islands saved Brisbane from the full force of Cyclone Alfred

image.altText: A man armed with a rifle wearing camouflage gear standing alongside a green and yellow passenger train carriage

props.synopsis: Pakistan authorities say the day-long stand off involving hundreds of hostages has ended.

title.children: Pakistan's army says 21 hostages dead after train siege ends

image.altText: Donald Trump standing in the Oval Office. To his left is Arthur Sinodinos and to his right, Arthur's wife Elizabeth.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese may be under attack from the Coalition, but former ambassador Arthur Sinodinos knows Donald Trump and believes the PM has taken the right approach to US tariffs.

title.children: 'Eyeball' Trump: Former ambassador's advice for Australia's next PM

image.altText: A journalist wears sunglasses, helmet and a vest with a "press" badge as he carries a camera tripod on his left shoulder.

props.synopsis: Afghans who fled after the Taliban takeover were all set for new lives in the United States until Donald Trump signed an executive order pausing the refugee program, leaving people with approved visas and booked flights dreading a return to Taliban rule.

title.children: These Afghans trusted the US, but now they say it's handed them 'a death sentence'

image.altText: Three people hugging in a crowd

props.synopsis: The centre-right Demokraatit Party has won the most votes in Greenland's parliamentary elections, a surprise result as the territory went to the polls in the shadow of US President Donald Trump's stated goal of taking control of the island one way or another.

title.children: Centre-right party wins Greenland's election as Trump seeks control

props.synopsis: The Prime Minister has agreed insurance companies are ripping us off. So, how will they respond as tens of thousands of claims are lodged after flooding in the wake of ex-Cyclone Alfred?

title.children: Can we afford ‘rip off’ insurance after Alfred?

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Anti-Semitic graffiti sprayed on a white car parked in a driveway.

props.synopsis: The ABC can reveal that one of the 14 people arrested by detectives under Strike Force Pearl earlier this week is believed to have helped orchestrate five instances of antisemitic vandalism and arson during January.

title.children: Man police allege to be key figure in five Sydney antisemitic attacks revealed

image.altText: Damaged residential buildings after being hit with a missile

props.synopsis: Four civilians have been killed in a Ukrainian attack on Russia's western Kursk region, Russian officials say.

title.children: Ukrainian attack in Kursk kills four as Russia 'studying' ceasefire proposal

image.altText: An aerial shot of a harbour.

props.synopsis: The Australian Maritime Safety Authority is investigating how the divers came to be left behind before being rescued by a passing ferry.

title.children: Two scuba divers left behind in ocean during dive trip

image.altText: A smiling, dark-haired man with a beard — actor Leonardo DiCaprio.

props.synopsis: The Oscar-winning actor is not happy with the federal energy minister for signing off on a bauxite mine expansion that would see 3,855 hectares of native forest cleared.

title.children: Leonardo DiCaprio slams Australian government over mine expansion

image.altText: Full moon in cloudy sky above Byron Bay lighthouses

props.synopsis: While America is set to see an incredible "blood moon" this week, only a fraction of Australians will see a sliver of the final moments of a partial lunar eclipse. Here's when and what to look for if you are one of the lucky ones.

title.children: Millions will see a 'blood moon' eclipse this week. But what about Australia?

image.altText: Men appearing above the roof of a dark, dust-covered 4WD alongside other vehicles with their headlights on at night

props.synopsis: Armed men stormed the home of Noureddine al-Labbad in the town of Al-Sanamayn, opening fire on him and his brother before fleeing, the Syrian Observatory for Human Rights says.

title.children: Former Syrian diplomat shot dead as death toll from mass violence rises above 1,300

image.altText: A man driving a dingy.

props.synopsis: The family of Victorian Steven Payne, who was killed on WA's remote south coast, say he "loved his partner deeply, cherished his family, thought the world of his best mates, and was devoted to his dog".

title.children: Family of shark attack victim remember 'gentle giant' who wouldn't support cull

image.altText: The door to a pod, numbered '2', opens.

props.synopsis: A trailer fitted with sleeping pods intended to give homeless people a safe and warm place to sleep at night is up for sale after a charity was refused permission to operate them on council land.

title.children: Charity to sell homeless sleeping pods after failing to secure a spot for them

image.altText: Blurred numbers on the ASX stock boards

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is now close to what financial market participants call a "technical correction".

title.children: What does a 'slow motion sell-down' mean for our superannuation?

image.altText: A teenage girl whose face is pixelated lies in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: Kmart is investigating the incident and the 13-year-old girl's mother hopes her story will alert other parents to the potential dangers of products used by young people.

title.children: Kmart pulls skincare product after teen hospitalised with eye pain

image.altText: Flames and smoke visible on hills

props.synopsis: Tasmania has been treated to both ends of the spectrum, with a bushfire burning near a west coast town at the same time as a massive storm front delivering large hail in other parts of the state.

title.children: Tasmania dealing with bushfires, hail as storm front sweeps over

image.altText: Seven young people each holding a different giant foam letter to make up Heywire, jump in front of Parliament House.

props.synopsis: The ABC is calling on community organisations to help bring inspiring ideas developed by young people at this year's Heywire Regional Youth Summit to life.

title.children: Heywire grants on offer to help make 'incredible' regional ideas real

image.altText: A middle-aged man with white hair stands in a park and speaks into a microphone.

props.synopsis: Health authorities in Townsville are urging people to take precautions following a rare diphtheria diagnosis and a growing cluster of dengue fever infections.

title.children: Vaccinated teen gets diphtheria amid 'full outbreak response' to dengue cases

image.altText: A blurring image of Andrew Walsh.

props.synopsis: Two men who killed a man and then buried his body in a concrete slab at a Brisbane transport depot three years ago have been handed life sentences.

title.children: Two men sentenced for killing and burying man in concrete slab

image.altText: A US influencer holding a joey wombat that is in distress with its mouth open

props.synopsis: A US hunting influencer is under fire after posting a video of herself capturing a wild baby wombat off the side of the road.

title.children: US influencer criticised for temporarily taking joey wombat from mother
